name: bacula-fd-static
description: A statically linked version of the Bacula File Daemon (FD), part of the Bacula backup suite. Designed for environments where dynamic linking is not feasible, such as embedded systems or minimal Linux installations.
usage: Run the Bacula File Daemon: bacula-fd -c /etc/bacula/bacula-fd.conf
features: Self-Contained: No external dependencies required
Backup Flexibility: Supports full, incremental, and differential backups
Encryption: AES-256 encryption for secure data transfer
Cross-Platform: Works with Bacula Director on any supported OS
Low Resource Usage: Optimized for minimal memory and CPU consumption

name: bacula-fd
description: The Bacula File Daemon (FD) is a client component of the Bacula backup system. It communicates with the Bacula Director to perform file-level backups and restores.
usage: Start the Bacula File Daemon: bacula-fd -c /etc/bacula/bacula-fd.conf
features: File-Level Backup: Granular control over backup sets
Compression: Built-in Zlib and LZO compression
Scheduling: Integrates with Bacula Director for automated backups
Restore Capabilities: Point-in-time recovery and file-level restores
Cross-Platform: Compatible with Linux, Windows, and macOS

community_and_support.forums: Bacula community forums and Stack Overflow
